definition: title granted to a person (archaic)/to ban an (online) account
to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: If you ignore the warning and keep on flaming , you will be banned without notice.
sentences.chinese: 如果無視警告繼續攻擊對方，則不經通知直接封號。

sentences.english: "Wanfo Lake" tourism development should be said that those who gave it "character.
sentences.chinese: “萬佛湖”應該說是旅遊開發者給它的美麗封號。

sentences.english: I'm 23 years old and got banned from a virtual farming game for threatening children.
sentences.chinese: 我23歲，因爲威脅兒童被虛擬農場遊戲封號。

sentences.english: Are seal numbers checked against the manifest at time of unlading ?
sentences.chinese: 貨時根據集裝箱明細單檢查封號？

sentences.english: If I could have one more medal, I would. But I just can't.
sentences.chinese: 那就這麼多勳章，西域分王這個封號留着。

sentences.english: She has confirmed that she will accept the honour of a peerage.
sentences.chinese: 她已經證實自己將接受貴族封號。

definition: Lee Teng-hui (1923-2020), Taiwanese politician, president of ROC 1988-2000
to seize/to capture/to wrest control of
to fail to be chosen (or elected)/to lose an election
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
